description: First attested in the 1910s in the US Northeast. Likely from German nit, dialectal form of nichts (“nothing”), or Yiddish ניט‎ (nit), dialectal form of נישט‎ (nisht, “no”), although some dictionaries give the alternative etymology nit (“louse egg; something very small”) +‎ wit.

examples: If you don't remember you are a nitwit. If you do answer, well, you know what the penalty is for perjury.
